TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed Rotation extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies the rotation to apply to a bitmap image.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Only 90 degree increments are supported.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to apply a rotation to a bitmap image.
[!code-cs[bitmapimageprops#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/BitmapImageProps/BitmapImageProps.cs#1)] [!code-vb[bitmapimageprops#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/BitmapImageProps/BitmapImageProps.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Media.Imaging.Rotation Rotate0 = int32(0)

Docs.summary: The bitmap is not rotated. This is the default value.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Media.Imaging.Rotation Rotate180 = int32(2)

Docs.summary: Rotate the bitmap clockwise by 180 degrees.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Media.Imaging.Rotation Rotate270 = int32(3)

Docs.summary: Rotate the bitmap clockwise by 270 degrees.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Media.Imaging.Rotation Rotate90 = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Rotate the bitmap clockwise by 90 degrees.
